snippet: A new national study found that the more college money provided, the lower the student’s grades.
abstract: National study published in American Sociological Review shows that, across all kinds of four-year institutions, college students who receive more money from their parents have lower grades; findings go against conventional wisdom that the more parents give, better the child performs in school.
lead_paragraph: A new national study found that the more college money provided, the lower the student’s grades.

headline.seo: Parents’ Financial Support Linked to College Grades
headline.main: Parents’ Financial Support May Not Help College Grades
headline.print_headline:
Parents’ Financial Support
Linked to College Grades
